intro: Bonapartea stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf bonapartea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Bonapartea stricta thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions.
